chargeHist.descr: Strangulation and Suffocation, Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury

result.execSummary:
The defendant Shayne R Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Misdemeanor Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: In the event that the defendant is discharged from probation with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent SHALL notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment SHALL be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  1/21/16: Court orders defendant to discharge from probation as of March 1, 2016.

miscConds.notes: Defendant to pay court costs, including the DNA Surcharge and the Domestic Abuse Surcharge.  Bond money to be applied and balance to be returned to poster.
Defendant to receive an AODA evaluation and follow through with any treatment.
Defendant not to consume alcohol or enter taverns.
Defendant to write an apology letter to B.K..    Defendant is to comply with any treatment/programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and agent.

timeConds.notes: Last 30 days of jail sentence STAYED if Defendant performs 80 hours of community service within the 1st year of probation.  Defendant to report for jail sentence on or before 2/13/15 at 5:00 pm.  Defendant eligible for huber privileges for work and child care.  02/13/2015:  Court orders Defendant to report for jail sentence by 03/13/2015 at 7:00 pm.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Taavi McMahon for the State; Def appeared in person w/atty Richard Schaumberg.  State moves to amend Count 1.  Court grants motion to amend.  Court advised Def of rights.  Def KVI waives rights.  Court finds Def KVI waives rights.  Def enters plea to amended charge.  Court finds Def G.  Def sentenced.

Attorney Schaumberg requested the 12/11/14 hearing be canceled and set for a PLEAS. DA McMahon does not object. Court approved request.
